Breeding adult.description: Double-crested Cormorants are larger than Neotropic. Breeding adults separated by size and shape of bare skin patch; fully surrounds the bill with a rounded border on Double-crested, but is only below the eye with a triangular border on Neotropic.

Juvenile.description: Larger than Neotropic Cormorants. Juveniles have a paler neck and breast than juvenile Neotropic Cormorants.

Adult male.description: Anhingas are larger with a much longer neck, tail, and bill than Neotropic Cormorants.

Female/immature.description: Anhingas are larger with a much longer neck, tail, and bill than Neotropic Cormorants. Females/immatures have a paler neck than juvenile Neotropic Cormormants.

Breeding male.description: Red-breasted Mergansers have a shorter tail, a shorter neck, and a longer bill than Neotropic Cormorants. They also have a red (not yellow) bill.

Female/nonbreeding male.description: Red-breasted Mergansers have a shorter tail, a shorter neck, and a longer bill than Neotropic Cormorants. They also have a red (not yellow) bill.
